oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nonuniform fiber gratings in optical networks

SHEVGAONKAR, RK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: fiber optic networks
multiplexing equipment

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Grating based devices have received wide popularity in a variety of fiber optic communication applications due to their versatile characteristics and compactness. One of the important features of a fiber Bragg grating (FBG) is its extremely narrow bandwidth. In a WDM network the grating filters can be used as wavelength selective and add-drop devices. In the paper we study the crosstalk characteristics of a nonuniform fiber Bragg grating (NUFBG) used in optical networks as a demultiplexer.
